page.title: 12WITHERIDGE FIRE STATION
page.content: Witheridge has it's own Fire Service station which is manned by ten part time firemen.They each carry an alerter and when it bleeps they race to the fire station.The alerters have a radius of three miles.A full crew consists of six men , two of whom carry breathing aparatus.They spend one night a week on fire drill.They are called out to all fires but the usual ones in this area are chimney fires and barn fires. Witheridge fire station is under control of the Exeter H.Q. , but have a sub-officer and two leading firemen. The part time firemen all have other jobs and sometimes it is difficult to leave what they are doingin order to answer the call to a fire.
